{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the documents, the lymphatic vessels from the body of the tongue are divided into marginal and central. The marginal vessels drain the tongue's apex, marginal surface, and sublingual region into the submental and submandibular nodes. The central vessels are located at the tip of the tongue, travel through the mylohyoid muscle, and drain into the jugulo-omohyoid or jugulodigastric nodes. The dorsal vessels collect lymphatic drainage from the area posterior to the sulcus and drain into the jugulo-omohyoid and jugulodigastric nodes. Based on this information, the lymph from the tongue is not drained by the ventral vessels. Therefore, the answer is B. Ventral.", "answer_choice": "B"}
